title: Misconception Correction Cycle
description: An interactive circular workflow diagram showing the four-stage framework for correcting learner misconceptions: Activate (surface beliefs), Conflict (create dissonance), Resolve (provide better model), and Consolidate (reinforce learning).
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: misconception correction
conceptual change
cognitive conflict
instructional design
learning psychology
relation: Part of the Automating Instructional Design intelligent textbook
coverage: Educational technology, learning science, misconception remediation
audience: Instructional designers, educators, curriculum developers, educational psychologists
technicalRequirements: Modern web browser with JavaScript enabled
learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of misconception correction cycle
Explore misconception correction cycle through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of misconception correction cycle to solve problems
Test understanding of misconception correction cycle through interactive exercises
